meanings.definition: Cause (something) to be out of focus.
meanings.sent1: When I move the camera too quickly, it defocuses the image.
meanings.sent2: The photographer defocuses the background to make the subject stand out.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten defocuses the camera by pawing at the lens.
meanings.sent4: Her tears defocus the world around her, making everything blurry.
meanings.sent5: The fog defocuses the distant mountains, creating a dreamy effect.

meanings.definition: Lose or cause to lose focus.
meanings.sent1: During the lecture, my mind often defocuses and wanders.
meanings.sent2: The tired student's eyes defocus as she struggles to stay awake.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel defocuses on the task at hand and chases a butterfly instead.
meanings.sent4: His excitement defocuses his attention, causing him to miss important details.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise outside defocuses me from my work, making it hard to concentrate.
